title: 113_hr3665
content: The Act may be cited as the "Medical Foods Equity Act of 2013". Congress finds that newborns are screened for inborn errors of metabolism, but insurance coverage for treatment is inconsistent. Approximately 2,550 children in the US are diagnosed with these disorders annually, requiring specialized diets or supplements. Over 35 states have laws addressing coverage inequities for medically necessary foods. The financial burden of providing these foods is significant for many families, as there is currently no cure for inborn errors of metabolism. There is no cure for inborn errors of metabolism disorders, requiring lifelong treatment. SEC. 3. Coverage in certain federal health programs for medically necessary food and low protein modified food. Coverage under the Medicare program includes medically necessary food and low protein modified food for the treatment of certain conditions as recommended by the Advisory Committee on Heritable Disorders. The Medicare program covers medically necessary food formulated for specific dietary management of diseases under medical supervision. This includes nutritionally modified foods and formulas.
